edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit

Interface GarblingParameters

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FreeXORGarblingParameters, MinimizeAESSetKeyGarblingParameters, StandardGarblingParameters

    public interface GarblingParameters
    A general interface for a circuits' garbling parameters.

    Each type of a circuit (standard, FreeXor, MinimizeAESSetKey, etc) has different parameters and should have a related garbling parameters' class.

    All parameters classes should implement this interface.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Detail

      • createCircuitUtil

        edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit.CircuitTypeUtil createCircuitUtil()
        Creates and returns a unique utility class.

        There are some functionalities in the circuit that have different implementations in different kinds of circuit. In case of such function, the circuit calls a utility class corresponding to the concrete circuit. The utility class is given to the circuit in the construct time by the input object, using this function. The parameters class is specific for each circuit so it knows exactly which utility class to create.

        Returns:
        the created utility object.

      • getUngarbledCircuit

        BooleanCircuit getUngarbledCircuit()
        Returns:
        the boolean circuit that was garbled.

      • setKDF

        void setKDF(KeyDerivationFunction kdf)
        Sets a KDf object that uses in the row reduction technique.
        Parameters:
        kdf - to use in the row reduction technique.

      • getKDF

        KeyDerivationFunction getKDF()
        Returns the KDF object used in the row reduction technique.
